text: Alfonso Wong (, 1925 - 1 January 2017) was a Hong Kong manhua artist. He also wrote under the pen name "Wong Chak" (), which is his son's name. He created the comic strip Old Master Q (Lao Fu Zi), which has been published since 1962. He was born in Tianjin, China and moved to Hong Kong in 1960. He had six sons. Wong died from organ failure on 1 January 2017 in California, United States. He was 91. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Comics artists Category:Comics writers Category:20th-century Chinese writers Category:Deaths from multiple organ failure Category:Disease-related deaths in California Category:Hong Kong people
title: Alfonso Wong
